items.description: Using a cellphone during class. (Allowed only for genuine emergencies with the teacher’s permission.)
Using gadgets that create noise during class unless permitted by the teacher for academic use.
Frequent absences of more than one week without a written explanation.
Habitual tardiness (frequently arriving late to classes within a week).
Frequent cutting of classes.
Leaving the classroom without the teacher’s permission (discourtesy/disrespect).
Exiting the school gate without proper permission recorded by the guard and without teacher approval.
Leaving school grounds without valid health reasons and proper documentation. (Only allowed for illness requiring medical attention, with a recorded pass slip and escort/parent pickup.)
Failure to wear the proper school uniform.
Failure to wear the school identification card (ID).
Wearing earrings/body piercings (male or female) that give an undesirable impression for a student.
Wearing rings, spikes, or large metal belt buckles that could be used as weapons.
Bringing or displaying objects resembling explosives or items associated with terrorism.
Spitting anywhere.
Leaving the restroom dirty after use.
Smoking within school premises.
Throwing trash anywhere.
Vandalism and related acts.
Intentionally damaging school property (chairs, doors, windows, lights, classroom/school facilities).
Damaging the school ID.
Failure to return borrowed school property (learning materials, library equipment, laboratory items).
Stealing school property or belongings of teachers/staff.
Bringing or drinking alcoholic beverages, or entering school under the influence of alcohol.
Possession or use of illegal drugs or similar substances (e.g., marijuana, shabu).
Gambling in any form.
Displaying obscene or indecent behavior.
Bringing pornographic materials or watching obscene films with others.
Dissemination or distribution of obscene materials.
Cheating during quizzes, examinations, or academic work.
Cheating or falsifying school records.
Forging the signature of a parent, guardian, teacher, or school staff; using forged signatures for fraudulent purposes.
Using another person’s ID to enter the school.
Lending one’s own ID to another student to allow entry.
Creating noise that disturbs classes.
Loitering in corridors causing noise or disturbance that disrupts classes.
Using vulgar or obscene language that offends others.
Disrespect toward teachers and school personnel.
Provoking or engaging in fights that cause disorder inside or outside the school.

Bullying of any kind (verbal threats, intimidation, excessive teasing, extortion, exclusion), including physical, psychological, emotional, or cyberbullying, and any acts covered by the Anti-Bullying policy.
Sexual harassment (verbal or physical), including touching of private parts, exposure of private parts, rape, or any act covered by the Child Protection Policy (CPP).
Physically hurting a fellow student or a teacher.
Killing a fellow student or any person within the school.
Disrespect or violence toward teachers and school personnel.
Joining a fraternity or sorority that causes harm or disorder.
Starting a brawl or riot inside or outside the school that endangers others.
Participation in initiation/hazing that may cause injury or death (sanctions depend on the effect on the victim).
Soliciting outside the school without legal authorization or permission.
Deceiving or misleading parents or guardians regarding approved school activities or collections.
Selling tickets not authorized by the school administration.
Using the school’s name in wrongdoing or in activities that damage its good reputation.
Frequent and repeated violations of school rules and regulations, subject to sanctions depending on the degree and nature of the offense.
